resources.string: This is a premium feature. Please unlock Strongify to use it.
Add exercise to circuit or superset

Please select a periodicity for your reminder.

Default set mass when adding an exercise to a workout: %1$s
Repeat %1$s seconds before the end of the timer

Version %s
Strongify
Contact address: jessy.barthelemy08@gmail.com

Notifications sound :
Emotion sounds Ringing bell - happy.wav by domrodrig of Freesound.org

Bell, Counter, A.wav by InspectorJ (www.jshaw.co.uk) of Freesound.org

Bicycle_bell_01.wav.wav by magedu of Freesound.org
Decline close grip bench to skull
Wide grip biceps curl with barbell
Smith machine close grip bench press
One arm low pulley triceps extension
Push ups with feet on ball
Front squat to bench with barbell
One arm preacher curl with dumbbell
Close grip triceps press to chin with barbell

Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.
Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.
With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out so that your back is straight.
Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.

Lay down on a bench, the bar should be directly above your eyes, the arms are stretched and shoulder-wide apart, palms outwards.

Bring it slowly down above your head with yours upper arms. Keep your arms tightened.
Bring it slowly up to the initial position.

Sit on the butterfly machine, the feet have a good contact with the floor, the upper arms are parallel to the floor.\nPress your arms together till the handles are practically together (but aren\'t!).\nGo slowly back. The weights should stay all the time in the air.

Lay down on your back a soft surface, the feet are on the floor. 

Ask a partner or use some other help (barbell, etc…) to keep them fixed, your hands are behind your head.

From this position move your upper body up till your head or elbows touch your knees. Do this movement by rolling up your back.

Hold the Barbell shoulder-wide, the back is straight, the shoulders slightly back, the arms are stretched.
Bend the arms, bringing the weight up. Without pausing, let down the bar with a slow and controlled movement.

Don't allow your body to swing during the exercise, all work is done by the biceps,which are the only muscles that should move (pay attention to the elbows).
Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.\n\nDo a slight rotation on the top of the movement with the weight.

Hold two barbells, the arms are stretched, the hands are on your side, the palms face inwards.

Bend the arms and bring the weight up. At the same time, rotate your arms by 90 degrees at the very beginning of the movement.
At the highest point, rotate a little the weights further outwards. Without a pause, bring them down, slowly.

Don't allow your body to swing during the exercise, all work is done by the biceps, which are the only muscles that should move (pay attention to the elbows).

With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder.\nLower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

Take a cable in your hands (palms parallel, point to each other), the body is straight.

Bend the arms and bring the weight up with a fast movement. Without any pause bring it back down with a slow, controlled movement, but don't stretch completely your arms.

Don't swing your body during the exercise, the biceps should do all the work here.
The elbows are at your side and don't move.

Hold two dumbbells and sit on a bench with a straight back, the shoulders are slightly rolled backwards. 

Your pals point to your body. Bend the arms and bring the weight up.
Don't rotate your hands, as with the curls. Without any pause bring the dumbbell down with a slow, controlled movement.

Don't swing your body during the exercise, the biceps should do all the work here. The elbows are at your side and don't move.

Place the EZ curl bar on the rest handles in front of the preacher bench.
Lean over the bench and grab the EZ curl bar with palms up.

Sit down on the preacher bench seat so your upper arms rest on top of the pad and your chest is pressed against the pad.
Lower the weight until your elbows are extended and arms are straight.
Bring the weights back up to the starting point by contracting biceps. Repeat.

Sit on a bench, keep your back straight.
Hold the dumbbells in front of you at your upper chest level with your palms facing your body.

Bring the weight up with a rotation of your wrist (palms out when you have your arms stretched).
Bring it down with the inverse rotation.

Lay down on a bench, the bar should be directly above your eyes, the knees are somewhat angled and the feet are firmly on the floor.

Concentrate, breath deeply and grab the bar more than shoulder wide.
Bring it slowly down till it briefly touches your chest at the height of your nipples. Push the bar up.

The movement is very similar to benchpressing with a barbell, however, the weight is brought down to the chest at a lower point.

Hold two dumbbells and lay down on a bench. Hold the weights next to the chest, at the height of your nipples and press them up till the arms are stretched.
Let the weight slowly and controlled down.
Perform a typical bench press, but hold the bar with your hands approximately shoulder-width apart and keep your elbows close to your body.

Lay down on a decline bench, the bar should be directly above your eyes, the knees are somewhat angled and the feet are firmly on the floor.\nConcentrate, breath deeply and grab the bar more than shoulder wide.\nBring it slowly down till it briefly touches your chest at the height of your nipples. Push the bar up.

Sit down on a bench, keep the lower back slightly bent.
Grab the dumbbells and place them above your shoulders, palms face inwards.
Bring the dumbbells up above your head and bring them inwards.
Bring it down to the initial position.

Put two benches so far apart, that you can hold onto one with your hands and are just able to reach the other with your feet.

The legs stay during the exercise completely stretched.

With your elbows facing back, bend them as much as you can. Push yourself up, but don't stretch out the arms.

Hold onto the bars at a narrow place (if they are not parallel) and press yourself up, but don\'t stretch the arms completely, so the muscles stay during the whole exercise under tension.\n\nNow bend the arms and go down as much as you can, keeping the elbows always pointing back, At this point, you can make a short pause before repeating the movement.

Lay down on a bench and stretch out your arms in front of you (neutral grip).

Bring the dumbbells down until your arm are forming a right angle.

Bring the dumbbells up at the starting position without make them collide.

Stand straight, foots are shoulder-wide apart, one dumbbell in each hand palms inwards.

Raise your arms in front of you until they are parallel to the floor. Keep your arms stretched during the execution.
Go back down to the initial position.

Stand straight, foots are shoulder-wide apart, one dumbbell in each hand, neutral grip.
Raise your arms along your body until they are parallel to the floor.
Keep your arms stretched during the execution.
Go back down to the initial position.

Position one dumbbell over head with both hands under inner plate (heart shaped grip).

With elbows over head, lower forearm behind upper arm by flexing elbows.
Flex wrists at bottom to avoid hitting dumbbell on back of neck.
Raise dumbbell over head by extending elbows while hyper extending wrists.
Return and repeat.

Put barbel on the back of your shoulders. Stand upright, then take the first step backward.

Step should bring you backward so that your supporting leg knee can touch the floor. 
Then stand back up and repeat with the other leg.

Put barbell on the back of your shoulders. Stand upright, then take the first step forward.
Step should bring you forward so that your supporting legs knee can touch the floor.
Then stand back up and repeat with the other leg.

Remember to keep good posture.

Take two dumbbells in your hands, stand straight, feet about shoulder wide.

Take one long step so that the front knee is approximately forming a right angle.
The back leg is stretched, the knee is low but doesn't touch the ground.

"Complete" the step by standing up and repeat the movement with the other leg.

Put the bar on your shoulders, keep the head straight , feet are shoulders-wide apart and your knee are slightly bent.

Bend your chest until it is parallel to the floor, your head always fixing in front of you.
Go back to the initial position.
Perform leg squats with barbell behind your legs.

Get into a position on the floor supporting your weight on your forearms and knees.
Arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.

Keep your body straight at all times and hold this position as long as possible.
To increase difficulty an arm or leg can be raised while performing this exercise.

Start with your body stretched, your hands are shoulder-wide apart on the ground.
Push yourself off the ground till you stretch your arms.
The back is always straight and as well as the neck (always look to the ground).
Lower yourself to the initial position and repeat.

Start with your body stretched, your hands are spaced from 10 cm on the ground.

Push yourself off the group till you stretch your arms.

Your back is always straight as well as your neck (always look to the ground).
Lower yourself to the initial position and repeat.

Lie on the press machine, put your feet on the platform, shoulder-wide apart, your feet outwards.\nBring the weight up until your legs are almost stretched.\nGo back to the initial position before peeling your pelvis without rounding off your back.

Lay down on a bench, one dumbbell in your hands and in front of your head, palms toward the ceiling.

Bring the weight down as much as possible.
Go back to the initial position.

Don't forget to add an additional clamp for the dumbbell.

Lay down on a bench and hold onto the recliner with your hands to keep you stable.\nHold your legs straight and lift them till they make an angle of about 45°. \nMake a short pause of 1 sec and go slowly down to the initial position.

Grab the barbell with a wide grip (slightly more than shoulder wide) and lean forward.
Your upper body is not quite parallel to the floor, but forms a slight angle.
The chest's out during the whole exercise.

Pull now the barbell towards your belly button, not further up.
Go slowly down to the initial position. 
Don't swing with your body and keep your arms next to your body.

Put a knee and a hand on a bench, keep your back straight.
Grab a dumbbell with your other hand.
Bring the weight up perpendicularly to the floor while raising your elbow as high as you can.
Go back to the initial position without totally stretching your arm.

The execution of this exercise is very similar to the regular bent over rowing, only that the bar is fixed here.

Grab the barbell with a wide grip (slightly more than shoulder wide) and lean forward.
Your upper body is not quite parallel to the floor, but forms a slight angle.
The chest's out during the whole exercise.
Pull now the barbell with a fast movement towards your belly button, not further up. Go slowly down to the initial position.
Don't swing with your body and keep your arms next to your body.

Stand with straight body, the hands are hanging freely on the side and hold each a dumbbell.
Lift from this position the shoulders as high as you can, but don't bend the arms during the movement. 
On the highest point, make a short pause of 1 or 2 seconds before returning slowly to the initial position.
When training with a higher weight, make sure that you still do the whole movement!

Stand firmly, with your feet slightly more than shoulder wide apart.
Stand directly behind the bar where it should barely touch your shin, your feet pointing a bit out. 

Bend down with a straight back, the knees also pointing somewhat out. Grab the bar with a shoulder wide grip.

Pull the weight up. At the highest point make a slight hollow back and pull the bar back.
Hold 1 or 2 seconds that position.

Go down, making sure the back is not bent.
Once down you can either go back again as soon as the weights touch the floor, or make a pause, depending on the weight.

Make sure you have put the barbell at a height where you can comfortably take it out and put it back in.
Take it out and make yourself ready:

The bar is somewhat lower than your shoulders.
The feet are quite apart and point out.
The head is in your neck and looks up.
The chest is out.

Go now slowly down, till your thighs are parallel with the floor, not lower.
The knees point outwards, your butt, out.
Make a small pause of 1 second and with as much energy as you can, push the weight up.
Make a pause of 2 seconds and repeat.

Lay flat on your stomach with your arms extended in front of you on the ground as your legs are lying flat.

Lift both your arms and legs at the same time, as if you were flying, and contract the lower back. 

Make sure that you are breathing and, depending on your fitness level, hold the movement for at least two to five seconds per repetition.

Grab the pull up bar with a wide grip, the body is hanging freely.\nKeep your chest out and pull yourself up till your chin reaches the bar or it touches your neck, if you want to pull behind you.\nGo with a slow and controlled movement down, always keeping the chest out.
You have an exercise without sets
Image too big to be displayed
You cannot change exercise during superset or circuit.
Strongify can display the chronometer on top of other application but has to have a permission enabled in order to do that.\n\nWould you like to enable this feature?
If you like Strongify, could you take a moment to review the app?

Strongify is a free application in development.

If you have any suggestions for improvements let us know on the Strongify facebook page.

For starters you can create a new workout routine by clicking on the plus button.
You can add normal, superset, or circuit exercise by clicking on the plus button.
By clicking the plus button, a new set will be created with the settings of the latest set.\n\nData are automatically saved when you go back to the exercises list.
You can either start a workout by clicking on the play button or setting the workout by clicking on the title.
Please note that a measure already exists for this date, she will be overwritten.
Sharing of my workout via Strongify
Error while removing ads. Please check your internet connection.
You have successfully removed ads. Please restart your application.
